hero.saudation2: and I create high-performance and scalable applications.
hero.description: I'm a Mobile Developer, Speaker, and Content Creator at

about.title: About Me
about.content:
If you already know me, you know my name is Lucas Alvarenga, but many people also call me Alvarenga! I am a self-taught Android developer with 5 years of experience creating high-quality applications. I have strong skills in designing, developing, and testing Android apps, along with solid knowledge of programming languages, libraries, and essential frameworks for the ecosystem. I enjoy solving problems, working in a team, and self-managing to deliver efficient Android development solutions.

I started programming at the age of 13, specifically with Android, using Java back in 2017. As I was about to enter high school, I wanted to study at a technical school. The following year, I enrolled at Rezende Rammel to take an IT course. It was three incredible years where I deepened my knowledge, especially in Java and later in Kotlin. Additionally, I had contact with other languages such as JavaScript, PHP, C, and Pascal, as well as frameworks like React.js and Flutter.

In 2020, I finally decided that I wanted to pursue a career as an Android developer. I went through several selection processes and interviews until I landed my first internship, and within just three months, I was hired. At the same time, since August 2019, I have been creating technology content, documenting my journey from student to software developer.

carrer.title: Career
carrer.description: Below is a summary of my resume, professional experience, and education.

experience1.title: Android Developer
experience1.list: Modularization and MVVM architecture implementation | Android Jetpack Libraries | CI/CD | AWS | Firebase | Accessibility | Robot Framework | Android | iOS

experience2.title: Android Developer
experience2.list: Modularization and MVVM architecture implementation | Unit testing with JUnit 5 and MockK | Android Jetpack Libraries | Participation in Design/Discovery processes | RESTful API integration | Dependency Injection with Koin

experience3.title: Junior Android Developer
experience3.list: Development of new features defined by the team | Unit tests with JUnit 5 + MockK | Android Jetpack Libraries | Detekt | RESTful API integration | Zendesk integration

experience4.title: Android Developer Intern
experience4.list: Development of new features and bug fixes | Firebase (Crashlytics, Messaging, App Distribution...) | Android Jetpack Libraries | Picasso | Glide

education1.title: Technical Degree in IT
education1.description: ETRR helped me learn about technology. I had the opportunity to explore front-end, back-end, and mobile development.

education2.title: I study several courses every year
education2.description: I never stop learning! I believe continuous learning is essential to unlocking our potential in an ever-changing world.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Here is a gallery with some projects I have developed over time.

project1.name: Marketplace List
project1.description: This simple shopping list application will help you create your list and know the final purchase price!

project3.name: AlvaFlix
project3.description: A joke with my last name Alvarenga and Netflix

project4.name: Crypto - UI/UX
project4.description: Fictional project from Felipe Santanas' Figma Course (FEUX), aimed at improving my knowledge of Figma and UI/UX.

project5.name: AlvaMessenger
project5.description: In this application, I worked deeply with Firebase, using it to create a new messaging application (I guess I wasn't very creative with names in high school).

project6.name: Time to Sleep
project6.description: This project was developed in my second year of high school with the goal of being an alarm clock for the deaf!

footer.message:
'We should not do things expecting something in return.
Do what needs to be done, and the reward will come naturally in due time.'
